alert.note: Alert for Bureau (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 3:07AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Slow-moving thunderstorms will impact portions of central Bureau County through 415 AM CDT... At 306 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow-moving thunderstorms along a line extending from near Osceola to near Woodhaven Lakes. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Wyanet, Tiskilwa, La Moille, Buda, Ohio, Malden, Milo, Dover, Providence, Kasbeer, Van Orin, and Bureau County Fairgrounds. This includes Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 47 and 61. Rainfall amounts of one to two inches have fallen and an additional one to two inches of rain are possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed.
